title.narrative: The provision of a full package support and services for 150 older persons and 80 caregiver/youth of Lebanese, Syrians, PRS and PRL including those with disabilities and care givers in Mina, Bab Al Tabbani, Jabal Mehsen, Quobbe and Baddawi regions of Tripoli

description.narrative:
The “Forum of The Handicapped” is a non-governmental organization founded in 1986 as an independent living center, managed and supervised by persons with disabilities themselves. The Forum is concerned to provide services that insure the utmost possible integration of persons with disabilities in society. The Forum’s programs include health, educational, cultural, intellectual, artistic services in addition to some basic services such as accessible transportation and the provision of assistive devices to persons with disability. The Forum is also a solid defender of disability rights in Lebanon by calling for the full implementation of the law 220/2000 on disability in Lebanon. Moreover, the Forum seeks to raise awareness on disability rights within the community and aims to change people attitude towards disability from the charity approach to the rights based approach on the issue. This project proposal is designed to provide comprehensive community based care and support services to promote independent living as well as the physical, social and psychological well-being of 330 older persons including those with disabilities and care givers. -Organizing personal assistance service to provide home support including personal care, medical assistance, the provision of daily households needs and other in house services.
The Forum of Handicapped is one of few independent living centers across Lebanon that supports PWDs with all the interventions needed to enhance the independent living in Mina, Bab Al Tabbani, Jabal Mehsen, Quobbe and Baddawi regions of Tripoli. This project will entail a full package of services that respond to the needs of 330 older persons including those with disabilities and care givers (Lebanese, Syrian, and PRS), in order to guarantee their rights to live in dignity. The project’s objectives are the following: - Promoting and maintaining optimal, independent, and active living - Providing integrated and developmental services and facilities to promote the well-being of older persons - The provision of accessible, residential care services to frail older persons who are 60 years of age and above, who are in need of continual care - Ensuring access to quality support including paramedical services The participation in the activities will be based on individual assessments and social studies to identify the older persons including those with disabilities and care givers, that will constitute our target groups. The main activities of the project include: - Counselling, case management, and referrals to partners when needed - Providing physiotherapy sessions for those in need with special attention to older persons with disabilities - Provision of health care services such as rehabilitation, and assistive devices (diapers, wheelchairs etc.) - Site improvement to make it more accessible for older persons with disabilities (ramps, accessible toilets, indoor accessibility, adequate furniture etc.) - Providing psycho - social support by creating older persons clubs, day care, touristic trips, and group social intervention as an alternative to institutionalization.
